com.foreach.across.modules.webcms.domain.component.model

Class WebCmsComponentModelHierarchy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.webcms.domain.component.model.WebCmsComponentModelHierarchy

  • @Component
 @Exposed
 @Scope(value="request",
       proxyMode=TARGET_CLASS)
public class WebCmsComponentModelHierarchy
extends Object
    Represents an ordered hierarchy of WebCmsComponentModelSets that have a scope name. Components can be looked up by name in the hierarchy in which case (depending on the parameter) all registered sets will be queried in reverse order until a result is returned.

    The hierarchy will always contain an initial scope name GLOBAL and DOMAIN. Both scopes will fetch a component from the repository only when it is requested. If no current domain is active, the DOMAIN scope will be an alias to GLOBAL. Otherwise the DOMAIN scope will contain all components shared across that domain.

    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

    • Method Detail

      • registerComponentsForScope

        public void registerComponentsForScope(WebCmsComponentModelSet componentModelSet,
                                       String scopeName)
        Add a set of components to the very end of the hierarchy. If a new scope name is specified, this scope will be registered as the first scope to look in. If an existing scope name is specified, the components will be replaced but the query order of that scope will not change.

        If an alias is being replaced by a separate set, it will be inserted right before the scope it was originally an alias for (so it will be queried earlier).

        Parameters:
        componentModelSet - to add
        scopeName - for which to register components

      • removeComponents

        public boolean removeComponents(String scopeName)
        Removes the components for that scope. If the scope is an alias for another scope, only the alias will be removed but the actual components will still be available under the original scope name.

        If the scope name is not an alias, the entire scope - including itse aliases - will be removed.

        Returns:
        true if the component set for that scope has been removed

      • removeComponents

        public boolean removeComponents(WebCmsComponentModelSet componentModelSet)
        Returns:
        true if component set has been removed

      • getComponentsForScope

        public WebCmsComponentModelSet getComponentsForScope(String scopeName)
        Parameters:
        scopeName - name
        Returns:
        components registered to that scope

      • setScopeOrder

        public void setScopeOrder(String... scopeNames)
        Re-order all scopes. All registered scope names must be mentioned or an exception will be thrown. Any unknown scope name will be ignored.

        Scope names are defined left-to-right but scopes will be traversed right-to-left when looking for components.

        If the names contains one or more aliases, the earliest occurrence of the entire set will be used.

        Parameters:
        scopeNames - in order

      • getScopeNames

        public Collection<String> getScopeNames()
        Returns:
        all registered scope names in their order - this will not show aliases

      • getDefaultScope

        public String getDefaultScope()
        Get the first scope that will be checked when requesting a component.
        Returns:
        scope name or null if the hierarchy is empty

      • get

        public WebCmsComponentModel get(String componentName)
        Get the component by name by traversing the entire hierarchy bottom up.
        Parameters:
        componentName - name of the component
        Returns:
        component or null if not found

      • get

        public WebCmsComponentModel get(String componentName,
                                boolean searchParentScopes)
        Get the component by name and optionally traverse the hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        componentName - name of the component
        searchParentScopes - true if parent scopes should be searched as well
        Returns:
        component or null if not found

      • getFromScope

        public WebCmsComponentModel getFromScope(String componentName,
                                         String scopeName)
        Get the component by name from the specific scope. Will not search any other (parent) scopes.
        Parameters:
        componentName - name of the component
        scopeName - name of the scope to start with
        Returns:
        component or null if not found

      • getFromScope

        public WebCmsComponentModel getFromScope(String componentName,
                                         String scopeName,
                                         boolean searchParentScopes)
        Get the component by name from a specific scope. Optionally traverse parent scopes looking for the component.
        Parameters:
        componentName - name of the component
        scopeName - name of the scope to start with
        searchParentScopes - true if parent scopes should be searched as well
        Returns:
        component or null if not found

      • registerAliasForScope

        public void registerAliasForScope(String alias,
                                  String targetScopeName)
        Add an alias for another scope. The target scope must exist. Any other set already registered under that alias will be removed.
        Parameters:
        alias - to add
        targetScopeName - the alias is for

      • containsScope

        public boolean containsScope(String scopeName)
        Returns:
        true if components scope is registered
